featured.text: People sometimes crash into reefs with their boats or drop anchors on them, breaking off large chunks of coral.
Higher ocean temperatures kill the important food source for the coral—the algae, the tiny greenish-gold water plants that live on coral.
Moreover, some people even break coral off to collect for 40 since it is so colorful and pretty.
This process, known as “coral bleaching,” has happened more and more frequently in recent years.

other.text: The last factor contributing to the 39 of coral reefs is people.
When the algae die, the coral loses its color and it also dies 38 .

definition.zh_def: 珊瑚是一種海洋生物，通常形成礁石，具有硬質外殼，並且是海洋生態系統的重要組成部分。
definition.en_def: Coral is a marine organism that typically forms reefs, has a hard outer structure, and is an important part of marine ecosystems.
definition.example: The coral reef is home to a diverse range of marine life.
